text: at what we deem premium prices or discount prices. When we see this high amount of volume being facilitated, it's telling us there's quite a lot of acceptance at that price point. And remember, highs and lows are not made on acceptance, rather they're made on sort of initiative being taken from sellers at higher prices, as prices are advertised at a discount. Then what kind of auction is occurring at the extreme so again note at very aggressive tops and bottoms we tend to see a strong auction process sellers take advantage of premium prices and buyers don't buy at premium prices so again in this example we can see that we see a lot of two-way trade between the buyers and sellers so again whilst the market did back kind of top that is in the market and more importantly the likelihood or the probability that at some point in the future we'll either retest or take out that high and new buyers then continue to move prices higher. And lastly, the rotation and the speed on the way down. Remember what I said to you, as these buyers run into responsive sellers at higher If those responsive sellers turn and become initiative sellers, the market will very quickly reverse what it did on the upside. So the mere fact that not only did we have almost a slowish type reversal, but again This market, whilst there was a little bit of initiative taken from the sellers, we do want to assess how the buyers and sellers are interacting at various prices. When there's an aggressive interaction at higher prices, that is telling us one thing. When there's not such an aggressive interaction, that's telling us another thing. What's imperative to understand is this kind of interaction, because that will determine what prices are likely to do going forward. Let's now look at the second example, which is an excess top.
